thread.title: Miller: 'Nothing was wrong' with Trump's travel ban
thread.title_full: Miller: 'Nothing was wrong' with Trump's travel ban | Washington Examiner

author: Gabby Morrongiello
title: Miller: 'Nothing was wrong' with Trump's travel ban
text:
President Trump 's decision to issue a new executive order on immigration is by no means an admission that his initial travel ban was flawed, White House policy adviser Stephen Miller told supporters and opponents of the current administration during a special event Tuesday night.
Speaking to attendees of a Fox News town hall in Ponte Vedra, Florida, Miller said "nothing was wrong" with the order Trump issued earlier this month to suspend travel from seven majority-Muslim countries and halt the U.S. Refugee Admittance Program.
"There was a flawed judicial ruling that was erroneous," he told Fox News' Martha MacCallum during an interview which was broadcast to the crowd.
"The reality is these countries were designated by President Obama and Congress in 2011 and 2016. The reality is that â€¦ this is an assessment based on the threat these countries pose today and going into the future, but more fundamentally is the position of the intelligence community that these countries today pose a threat to our country going forward," Miller explained.
  According to Miller, the latest executive order will take into account arguments made by a three-judge panel that blocked Trump's travel ban from being implemented earlier this month. The panel and several other federal judges claim the president's directive could violate constitutional guarantees such as due process and religious freedom.
"One of the big differences" with the new order, he said, "is that it's going to be responsive to the judicial ruling that didn't exist previously."
"These are mostly minor technical differences. Fundamentally, you're still going to have the same policy outcome for the country," Miller told MacCallum, adding that Trump and his administration "is fully committed to doing what is lawful, legal, just, decent and right to take care of patriotic citizens and their communities."
